meanings.definition: Make (someone) be quiet or stop talking.
meanings.sent1: She was hushing the noisy children in the library.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was hushing the class before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The baby started hushing the adults by babbling loudly.
meanings.sent4: The wind hushing through the trees sounded like a gentle shush.
meanings.sent5: The mother hushing her baby to sleep was a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The act of making someone be quiet or stop talking.
meanings.sent1: His hushing of the crowd was met with grateful silence.
meanings.sent2: The sudden hushing of the room indicated something important was about to be said.
meanings.sent3: The hushing of the audience by the comedian led to an unexpected punchline.
meanings.sent4: The hushing of the wind through the leaves created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The hushing of the waves against the shore was a calming lullaby.
